  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
Our top story tonight is the London bomb plot. British police forces
  found and dismantled a bomb made of a deadly mix of gases and nails parked
  outside of a popular nightclub in London's
  theater district. A second suspicious vehicle was found in a nearby
  neighborhood. Richard Roth will have the latest on the thwarted apparent
  attack and Bob Orr will report on the implications of this scare for the United States.
  
 
And I’ll talk to the former CIA head of
  counterterrorism, John Brennan. 
  
One day after the Supreme Court struck down public
  school integration programs, school districts across the United States
  are wondering what's next. National correspondent Byron Pitts will take a
  close look at one North Carolina
  district once hailed as a model for school integration and the demographic
  changes its schools have seen.
 
The iPhone finally makes its debut this evening, but
  with Apple's aggressive — and appealing — marketing campaign, is
  it possible that we’ve already heard too much? Our science and
  technology correspondent Daniel Sieberg will look at Apple's marketing
  strategies that have piqued so many people's interests.
 
We’ll end our broadcast tonight with a special
  Assignment America story that might leave you seeing double. Steve Hartman
  will introduce you to Fernando and Fernando, two young chess champs with an
  uncanny number of things in common — including their rivalry.
 
Thanks and I hope you have a great weekend!
 




Katie Couric
